article.title: On the microscopic structure of $πNN$, $πNΔ$ and $πΔΔ$ vertices

multiple_choice_question.text: What method is used to ensure a relativistically invariant description of the quark-pion system?
What is the main focus of the study regarding the electromagnetic structure of N and Δ?
choices: Determining the masses of bare baryons
Investigating the role of SU(6) spin-flavor symmetry
Calculating the effects of pion loops
Describing the interaction between quarks and gluons

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the key finding regarding the ratio of the coupling strengths  fπΝΔ : fπΝΝ : fπΔΔ ?
choices: The ratios are consistent with predictions from the non-relativistic constituent-quark model.
The ratios are significantly affected by relativistic effects, particularly for the πΔΔ vertex.
The ratios are independent of the chosen quark-pion coupling strength.
The ratios are insensitive to the details of the three-quark wave function.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main conclusion drawn from the comparison of the calculated  FπΝΝ with other models?
choices: The calculated FπΝΝ perfectly matches the results from other relativistic models.
The calculated FπΝΝ exhibits a faster fall-off at small Q2 compared to other models.
The calculated FπΝΝ falls off slower at higher Q2 compared to some parameterizations used in hadronic models.
The calculated FπΝΝ  is insensitive to the choice of the three-quark wave function.
